page.description: The Set Properties of Object(s) action sets specified properties of one or more field, text or button objects.

step.description: Select the window that contains the value data. There are two options:
If you selected "Another Form or Browse Window", select an open form or browse in the Window Name list.

Click the '+' icon to display a list of objects on the window that have properties. Select an object and click OK to add it to the list. Click the '-' icon to remove the currently selected item on the list.

For each object in the second list, click the '+' icon to display a list of properties. Select one or more properties and click OK to add it to the list. Click the '-' icon to remove the currently selected property on the list. These properties are displayed in the picture below.
For each object in the second list, specify how you will specify the fill property. There are three options:

case.description: "Specify a variable that contains the value"
"Specify an expression that evaluates to the value"

step.description: If you selected "Specify the value now", enter the text value in the Value field.
If you selected "Specify a variable that contains the value", select a variable from the Variable list.
If you selected "Specify an expression that evaluates to the value", enter an expression in the Expression field.
Optionally modify the comment that describes the action.
